provenance: Probably purchased from Mayuyama, Tokyo, by Saretta Barnet's parents--specifically for Saretta Barnet and her husband Howard--sometime between 1950 and 1970.  If not puchaed from Mayuyama, Tokyo, then probably purchased from Mathias Komor, New York, during the same period.

images.copyright: President and Fellows of Harvard College

title: Narcissus
dimensions:
H. 35.5 cm x W. 7.0 cm (14 x 2 3/4 in.) -- Tanzaku painting only
H. 145.5 cm x W. 31.2 cm (57 5/16 x 12 5/16 in.) -- Full scroll including hanging triangle and roller bar
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Gift of Saretta Barnet
medium: Tanzaku (elongated vertical poetry slip) mounted as a hanging scroll; ink, color and gold on silk, signed Insho and with seal of the artist
